events.title: :sparkles: Gitlab support (Part 2) - Tests
events.body:
## ----NOTE----

This PR should probably not be merged until the ossf-tests GitLab organization is made with the necessary tests.  This branch, however, can be used by those who want to perform experimental scorecard evaluations of their GitLab projects.

#### What kind of change does this PR introduce?

This PR creates the necessary GitLab support e2e tests and includes the experimental ability to conduct scorecard checks on GitLab repositories from the command line.

#### What is the current behavior?

I recently made a pull request laying down the foundations of how a gitlab client would be written, which is extended with this PR with the addition of tests and test frameworks.

#### What is the new behavior (if this is a feature change)?**

Most of the tests to demonstrate GitLab support for scorecard are demonstrated in this PR.  There are a few tests that I cannot verify (such as CI tests which require higher level GitLab accounts for testing).  For these tests the basic code outline is given meaning that anyone could quickly insert the url of a test repository for the test to work.
- [✔️] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes/features)

#### Which issue(s) this PR fixes

Fixes #2266 

#### Special notes for your reviewer

A large number of these tests reference GitLab projects that are under my name.  I assume that Scorecard will likely create an organization like ossf-tests in GitLab where all of the test repositories will be hosted.  When this happens the tests in this PR can be modified to include the ossf-test project urls, allowing this to likely be merged into the main scorecard repository.

#### Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?
If a user is running scorecard on a GitHub repository that includes the string "gitlab." in the title scorecard will now think that repository is actually a GitLab project, however this is an incredibly rare edge case.

#### Release-note
Repositories that include "gitlab." in their title will be assumed to be gitlab projects.


#### Link to previous PR:
https://github.com/ossf/scorecard/pull/2265#issue-1374867978

events.title: Opssf
Fix go 1.19 js wrapper issue
events.body:
This PR replaces one aspect of the #17 PR.

with Go 1.18, the js.Wrapper is no more available, so I removed it. See https://tip.golang.org/doc/go1.18

This will fix #16
events.comment:
@ptxmac I'm sorry, I lack details of the former & discontinued Go version.
In theory, I guess, there's a little chance of breaking behaviour.
I hesitate to adopt this PR with compiler flags and would like to ask for guidance & clarity first.

Where I have no clear understanding (and just a personal opinion) is, if support for the older Go version is a strong requirement. I have two things in mind. 
a) does the vert library state a goal, to support the former Go version with every release?
b) how many users are still on the former Go version?

Regarding a) I can't speak for this project (being just a contributor) but hoping @norunners or @jasikpark or other maintainers could give guidance here. E.g. is there a view on how many releases in the past of Go are supported by a vert release? There could be an answer, that vert would release a "v2" which would be Go1.18+, and for clients using older Go versions, they would not be able to use new releases. Being curious to hear their feedback. 

Regarding b) I see 15 projects listed by Github using this lib. One could simply check how up-to-date they are. Maybe there are no such users sticking on 1.17 or older ;)

events.title: Eviction gives "Could not return the broken resource to the pool" even if all resources are fine
events.comment:
> Yes, the error happens after I have used jedis.close() (many minutes after). The app is run in an Azure app service, so it is not easy to debug the TCP traffic here unfortunately. Do you have any experiences with Azure app service/Azure Redis and how quickly it will disconnect clients if not used?

@yangbodong22011 is right, use `close` instead of `returnResource` will solve the eviction problem, because close will also set `dataSource` property of Jedis instance to null in addition to call `returnResource`. without set `dataSource` property, eviction will call `close` again after remove the instance from pool, witch cause the `object not currently part of this pool` exception.

events.title: Documentation Inconsistency - Externalized Config, Using @ConfigurationProperties
.formLogin() support
events.body:
As said in [comment](https://github.com/springdoc/springdoc-openapi/issues/827#issuecomment-713368584) is there support for .formLogin()?

`@SecurityScheme(
        name = "basicAuth",
        type = SecuritySchemeType.HTTP,
        scheme = "basic"
)
public class Application`

`@SecurityRequirement(name = "basicAuth")
public class Controller `

`    @Bean
    public SecurityFilterChain filterChain(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {

        http.csrf().disable()
                .authorizeRequests()
                .antMatchers("/login").permitAll()
                .antMatchers("/v3/api-docs/**", "/swagger-ui/**", "/swagger-ui.html").permitAll()
                .anyRequest().authenticated()
                .and()
                .formLogin();

        return http.build();
    }`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67325745/174857351-1b705fa7-c0fe-4f2f-a29d-367ba366e88e.png)

**If change .formLogin() to httpBasic() that will work. But how to realize it with .formLogin()?**

As said in [swagger.io](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication) there are only 2 schemes(Bearer and Basic)
events.comment:
Hi @bnasslahsen,
I have raised this issue: https://github.com/springdoc/springdoc-openapi/issues/1931
And created this repo with sample code: https://github.com/adrianbob/springdoc-form-login
The form login is not working.

events.title: Spring Security form login only offers application/json req body type
events.comment:
I have also tried adding other properties that I thought might help like:
```
springdoc.default-consumes-media-type=application/x-www-form-urlencoded
springdoc.consumes-to-match=application/x-www-form-urlencoded
springdoc.default-support-form-data=true
```
Even so, the login endpoint is the only one listed in the swagger-ui, but the only available request body type is still application/json

I have also created this repo with the sample code: https://github.com/adrianbob/springdoc-form-login

events.title: Spring Security form login only offers application/json req body type
JDBC lock not working with PSQL due to SQL syntax
events.comment:
@cipianpascu that was the first version of the queries. The issue is that `INSERT INTO %s` gets resolved into `INSERT INTO lock` and `lock` is a keyword in MySQL so it has to be escaped. 
The current issue is that different databases escape keywords differently. So ``` is breaking PSQL syntax.

events.title: Apidoc Links in documentation point to 6.7.0
events.body:
In the documentation of v9.0.0 located at https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin the links to the apidoc of the gradle tasks point to an outdated documentation (the one from 6.7.0).

e.g. the link in chapter 2.3.1 for DockerOperation points to https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/api/com/bmuschko/gradle/docker/tasks/DockerOperation.html which belongs to https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/api/overview-summary.html which states its version as 6.7.0.

I assume, the correct link would be to https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/current/api/com/bmuschko/gradle/docker/tasks/DockerOperation.html which belongs to
https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/current/api/overview-summary.html which states its version correctly as 6.7.0.

The linked url misses the `current` path segment.
events.comment: Here are some screenshots with explanation, so you can see where I found the links. Starting at https://github.com/bmuschko/gradle-docker-plugin and following the link on the right In the linked userguide located at https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/current/user-guide/ (it is `current`) I browsed to [2.3. Custom task types](https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/current/user-guide/#custom_task_types) (still `current`) There I followed the link to [DockerOperation](https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/api/com/bmuschko/gradle/docker/tasks/DockerOperation.html) (not `current` anymore). To see what apidocs I was browsing I followed the [Overview](https://bmuschko.github.io/gradle-docker-plugin/api/overview-summary.html) link, which took me here and here it states v6.7.0 I hope this helps to reproduce this.

events.title: I as a Zeebe user want to set up a backoff timeout for failed tasks in a BPMN XML.
events.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In our cases, it would be cool to set up a constant backoff timeout if a task failed (i.e. between retries) in the BPMN XML.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I want to be able to set a backoff interval in the XML, somewhere near the retries.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We could add backoff support in the retries field. I.e. R3PT7m - retry 3 times with a delay of 7 minutes.
events.comment:
> @aleksander-dytko @felix-mueller Can you please have a look at the priority of this issue?

Hey @korthout! I can look at it, but close to the end of January 2023.

events.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In our cases, it would be cool to set up a constant backoff timeout if a task failed (i.e. between retries) in the BPMN XML.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I want to be able to set a backoff interval in the XML, somewhere near the retries.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We could add backoff support in the retries field. I.e. R3PT7m - retry 3 times with a delay of 7 minutes.

events.comment:
> @aivinog1 Could you confirm my previous message?

Hey @remcowesterhoud! Sorry for taking so long to response :( 

> You have created the Zeebe Keycloak Project. This project enables authentication to the Zeebe Gateway. This works by intercepting requests to the gateway and checking the authorization on these requests.
As you mentioned in your issue, with the java client and zbtctl you can set these authorisation headers. As a result the interceptor does not reject the request.
For the health checks you cannot set these authorisation headers. As a result the does reject the request, meaning the gateway will always report as unhealthy, even though this is technically not the case.

> This change allows you to set these authorisation to the healthcheck requests so your interceptor will no longer reject those requests.

Yes, I confirm this.

events.title: Update to the 17.0.5 JDK
events.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Because there is [a bug with JDK that is breaking the `cpu-shares` parameter of the Docker environment](https://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=8281181) it would be cool to see updates of the JDK in the base Zeebe's Docker image.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Just update the JDK in Zeebe's Docker Image to 17.0.5 as soon as it is available. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
You could switch to the 18 or even 19 JDKs but I think that you shouldn't do this in the patch versions :)

**Additional context**
The JDK bug heavily affects our Zeebe environment because we use this argument when running docker containers. As I can see right now Zeebe is using [this version of the image](https://hub.docker.com/layers/eclipse-temurin/library/eclipse-temurin/17.0.3_7-jre-focal/images/sha256-fce37e5146419a158c2199c6089fa39b92445fb2e66dc0331f8591891239ea3b?context=explore).
events.comment:
> @aivinog1 actually the `stable/8.0` branch is not using digest pinning and [points to the general `17-jre-focal`](https://github.com/camunda/zeebe/blob/stable/8.0/Dockerfile#L24) tag of the temurin image. Thus the next patch release will automatically be based on the latest 17 tag, being at least the 17.0.5 one from now on.

Awesome, thanks :)

events.title: Update to the 17.0.5 JDK
events.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Because there is [a bug with JDK that is breaking the `cpu-shares` parameter of the Docker environment](https://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=8281181) it would be cool to see updates of the JDK in the base Zeebe's Docker image.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Just update the JDK in Zeebe's Docker Image to 17.0.5 as soon as it is available. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
You could switch to the 18 or even 19 JDKs but I think that you shouldn't do this in the patch versions :)

**Additional context**
The JDK bug heavily affects our Zeebe environment because we use this argument when running docker containers. As I can see right now Zeebe is using [this version of the image](https://hub.docker.com/layers/eclipse-temurin/library/eclipse-temurin/17.0.3_7-jre-focal/images/sha256-fce37e5146419a158c2199c6089fa39b92445fb2e66dc0331f8591891239ea3b?context=explore).

Also, I want to mention that it would be cool to backport this in the 8.0.x also :)

events.title: Add provider property for dynamic loader flags
events.body:
In PE shared objects the search path can not be controlled by the loaded binary (in contrast to ELF).
Resolving additional dependencies provided by 3rd party DLLs in the same folder as the primary PKCS11 module.

This is required to avoid workarounds as needed for e.g. the default vendor-provided [YubiKey module](https://developers.yubico.com/yubico-piv-tool/YKCS11/).

events.title: Vmmem high CPU usage
events.body:
### Windows Build Number

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.21387.1]

### WSL Version

- [X] WSL 2
- [ ] WSL 1

### Kernel Version

5.10.16

### Distro Version

Ubuntu 20.04

### Other Software

_No response_

### Repro Steps

I'm struggling to actually repro this issue deterministically. But looks like more prominent when waking up from sleep.
**Whit this issue I'd like to gather feedback on how to collect the most useful information to debug this behavior.**

I tried to isolate the failing component (ex. not running Docker Desktop and WSL2 "only"), but I failed miserably.

Usually my workflow:
 - VSCode Stable v1.56.2 with WSL Remote v0.56.2 for work (usually Java + SQL)
 - VSCode Insiders v1.57.0 with WSL Remote v0.56.2 for personal projects (usually JS related)
 - Docker Desktop (Windows) v3.3.3 (64133) running (with mongo or postgres)

In the past I tried to alleviate the issue with a `.wslconfig` but didn't worked.

My machine (Lenovo X1 Carbon) has 16GB of RAM and usually Vmmem RAM consumption float around ~4GB.

Excluded those hiccups WSL2 experience is pretty neat and flowlessy.


### Expected Behavior

WSL2 stay idle when no user workload are launched.

### Actual Behavior

Vmmem "randomly" uses high cpu/power amount (60%-70%) for couple of minutes (2 to 5 min) before settling down. This also happen when on battery without doing anything WSL2 releated (but with Docker Desktop running), killing autonomy.

### Diagnostic Logs

I'll provide an .etl dump as the next hiccup occurs.
events.comment:
@kroegerama 

I experienced this before and now it is not reproduced.

Please notice that your windows is behind:

```
<Windows Version: 10.0.22000.1281
>Windows version: 10.0.22621.819  
```

Regards,

events.title: Command GETATTR APPTYPE and $DISPSERIALNO is not implemented
events.body:
When I trying to add subkey I got error:

```
gpg> addcardkey
gpg: key operation not possible: Invalid data
```

In log I see:

```
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 <- GETATTR SERIALNO
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167.4179323968]: PKCS#11: pkcs11h_token_enumTokenIds entry method=1, p_token_id_list=0x7ffc0e12dc20
...
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167.4179323968]: PKCS#11: pkcs11h_token_freeTokenIdList return
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 -> S SERIALNO D2760001240111503131B71F5E411111
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 -> OK
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 <- GETATTR APPTYPE
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 -> ERR 79 Invalid data <Unspecified source>
```

Same for 

```
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 <- GETATTR $DISPSERIALNO
gnupg-pkcs11-scd[17167]: chan_0 -> ERR 79 Invalid data <Unspecified source>
```

GnuPG version is 2.2.40
events.comment:
Without **FULL** log, I cannot trace the sequence.
Please debug this yourself based on the information you do not share and provide a patch.
Also, I am unsure what version is 2.2.40 there is no tag of this version.
I invested enough time.

events.title: fix: show client secret input for PKCE auth code flow
events.body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

### Description

Show the client secret input always (for the authorization code flow) regardless of the PKCE flag.

Closes #7913



### Motivation and Context

PKCE and Client Secrets are allowed to coexist and neither is designed as a replacement for the other. [1] It is wrong to assume that a client secret must not or cannot be used in combination with PKCE. Quite the opposite, when possible both PKCE and client secret should be used. [2] So the premises of #6290 and #8146 are not correct.

Admittedly, for users of the PKCE mechanism WITHOUT a client secret it might be a minor nuisance to see the client secret input in the Swagger UI. But they can just leave it empty. On the other hand, for users of the PKCE mechanism WITH a client secret it is more than just a nuisance if the client secret input is not shown. The Swagger UI becomes unusable for them (unless they've set a default value for the client secret, which will be used hiddenly without being shown to the user).

Therefore the right course of action for now would be to revert #7438 to show the client secret input always regardless of PKCE. In the future a new flag could be introduced to hide the client secret input regardless of the PKCE flag.

[1] https://oauth.net/2/pkce/
[2] https://www.oauth.com/oauth2-servers/pkce/



### How Has This Been Tested?

If the flag `usePkceWithAuthorizationCodeGrant` is set and the loaded API spec contains OAuth2 with the authorization code flow (i.e. `AUTH_FLOW_ACCESS_CODE`), the client secret input appears and an access token can be obtained from an authorization server requiring both PKCE and client secret.


### Screenshots (if appropriate):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18560720/199060972-096d1f7c-e9e3-463d-9bf1-ac5948213d2f.png)



## Checklist
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

### My PR contains... 
<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] No code changes (`src/` is unmodified: changes to documentation, CI, metadata, etc.)
- [ ] Dependency changes (any modification to dependencies in `package.json`)
- [x] Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)
- [ ] Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

### My changes...
- [ ] are breaking changes to a public API (config options, System API, major UI change, etc).
- [ ] are breaking changes to a private API (Redux, component props, utility functions, etc.).
- [ ] are breaking changes to a developer API (npm script behavior changes, new dev system dependencies, etc).
- [x] are not breaking changes.

### Documentation
- [ ] My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.
- [x] My changes require a change to the project documentation.
- [x] If yes to above: I have updated the documentation accordingly.

### Automated tests
- [ ] My changes can not or do not need to be tested.
- [x] My changes can and should be tested by unit and/or integration tests.
- [x] If yes to above: I have added tests to cover my changes.
- [ ] If yes to above: I have taken care to cover edge cases in my tests.

events.title: Loading into arrays/maps drops head comment (regression)
events.body:
**Describe the bug**
Loading into arrays/maps from files having a head comment drops the head comment. This is a regression as it has worked in yq 4.27.2 but I noticed it stopped working in yq 4.30.4. I was not able to identify the exact commit yet which introduced this bug. But it should be easy given the example files below, let me know if I should give it a shot bisecting it on my own. I hope though that you're much quicker with identifying the issue in the code.

Version of yq: 4.27.2 (works), 4.30.4 (does not work)
Operating system: linux
Installed via: binary release (old version), snap (new version)

**Input Yaml**
cats.yml:
```yaml
# my cats
- cat1
- cat2
```

animals.yml:
```yaml
- cats.yaml
```

**Command**
The command you ran:
```
yq '.[] |= load(.)' animals.yaml
```

**Actual behavior**

yq 4.30.4 (latest release) outputs unexpected behavior (head comment `# my cats` is gone):

```yaml
- - cat1
  - cat2
```

**Expected behavior**

yq 4.27.2 outputs expected behavior:

```yaml
- # my cats
  - cat1
  - cat2
```
**Additional context: Also fails with maps**

Note than when the file is loaded into a map:
```yaml
animals: cats.yaml
```
using `yq '.animals |= load(.)' animals.yaml`, the bug also appears with yq 4.30.4:

output:
```yaml
animals:
  - cat1
  - cat2
```

**Additional context: Foot comments are preserved**

The bug does not appear when `cats.yaml` contains a foot comment:
```
- cat1
- cat2
# end of cats
```

Output of `yq '.animals |= load(.)' animals.yaml`:
```yaml
animals:
  - cat1
  - cat2
  # end of cats
```

**Post scriptum**

This regression is a blocker for us as you can imagine that in reality, we do have a lot of animals (and many more cats than just 2), so preserving comments is really required to keep the herd under control :smile_cat:

@mikefarah Also, let me take the chance to thank you for that excellent tool you made!

events.title: Rerun fails with coverage and "dependent" subtests
events.body:
I've started to use the `--rerun-fails` option and noticed that when coverage profiling is enabled, the produced `coverage.out` file only contains the coverage from the failed but re-executed sub-tests.

For example:
```
$ gotestsum --rerun-fails --packages=. -- -coverprofile=coverage.out -coverpkg="." && go tool cover -func coverage.out
✖  . (2ms) (coverage: 76.9% of statements in .)

DONE 4 tests, 2 failures in 0.271s

✓  . (2ms) (coverage: 46.2% of statements in .)

=== Failed
=== FAIL: . Test_sayHello/Voldemort_makes_it_fail_every_second_time (0.00s)
    main_test.go:16: 
                Error Trace:    /home/agr/oss/gotestsum-rerun-dependent-subtests/main_test.go:16
                Error:          Received unexpected error:
                                afraid of Voldemort, cannot say hello
                Test:           Test_sayHello/Voldemort_makes_it_fail_every_second_time
    --- FAIL: Test_sayHello/Voldemort_makes_it_fail_every_second_time (0.00s)

=== FAIL: . Test_sayHello (0.00s)

DONE 2 runs, 6 tests, 2 failures in 0.509s
github.com/neiser/gotestsum-rerun-dependent-subtests/main.go:11:        sayHello        46.2%
total:                                                                  (statements)    46.2%
```

The above example usage is from [this little demo project to illustrate my issue](https://github.com/neiser/gotestsum-rerun-dependent-subtests), see `run-test.sh` script there.

I've tried to catch the `coverage.out` from the first run using with `--post-run-command="bash -c 'mv coverage.out $(mktemp coverage.out.XXXXXXXXXX)'"`, but that only produced one file. I assume that's because the post-run command is only executed after all re-runs are done by gotestsum. 

Do you have a suggestion how to calculate coverage correctly and/or generate a "merged" coverage.out file from all re-runs? 

Futhermore, I'd like to see a command line option such as `--rerun-all-subtests` which re-runs not only one specific failed sub-test, but essentially all tests of the test case containing the failed sub-test (i.e. find the root of a failed subtest separated by `/` and run that one again). That would help when a sophisticated integration test is split up into sub-tests and subsequent sub-tests need all previous sub-tests to be run to be successful. I can also prepare an illustration to this problem, but I hope you get the idea. What do you think?
events.comment: @dnephin Thanks for your very detailed reply. I fear you might have missed [my quoted demo already above](https://github.com/neiser/gotestsum-rerun-dependent-subtests), which shows that the solution you've been proposing pretty much works as expected. Or am I mistaken and you had another point?

events.title: Respect .gitignore
events.body: When running `codeowners` on a typical git repository, many files are printed which are actually not part of the repository because of `.gitignore`. Is that correct behavior? Would you consider that to be an improvement if this tool respects (and parses?) `.gitignore` if present?

events.title: Support for sections (Gitlab flavor)
events.body:
The [Gitlab documentation allows](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/code_owners.html#organize-code-owners-by-putting-them-into-sections) to introduce sections into the `CODEOWNERS` such as 

```
[README Owners]
README.md @user1 @user2
internal/README.md @user2
```

That enables Gitlab to show the code ownership within the UI a little bit nicer. Currently, running this tool (version 1.1.1) on such a file leads to the following error:
```
$ codeowners
line 1: unexpected character '[' at position 1
```

Would you be willing to allow support for this? Would you accept a PR for that (I haven't looked into the code yet though)

I'm interested in the status of the document [Caching Scan Results by Image Reference](https://github.com/aquasecurity/trivy-operator/blob/main/docs/design/caching_scan_results_by_repo_digest.md), as my team would really appreciate such a feature being implemented. The document reads as if there was already some implementation attempt for the operator code here, but I can't find any pull request or reference in the document to that code. Any pointer is appreciated, and if you don't have any objections, I could try and start implementation of this feature on my own.
events.comment: I've updated the issue title to reflect that we should/can implement this feature.

events.title: support for multiple rbac configmaps
events.body:
# Summary
Currently if we dont provide a config file with flag `--policy-file` argument, the ConfigMap `argocd-rbac-cm` from K8s is used as expressed in [here](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/blob/master/cmd/argocd/commands/admin/settings_rbac.go#L110). It will be great if we can provide multiple configmaps to increase maintainability of our RBAC configurations. If this is discussed earlier,  sorry for the duplicate issue.

# Motivation
Let's consider the case we are managing an environment with 100+ different teams. For each team, we should provide at least 3 lines of code in our configmap to be able to handle rbac over ldap. Managing a configmap which is that much huge is very difficult. Instead it would be better if we can create multiple configmaps per team and put a specific label on each configmap and then merge these proper labelled configmaps.

# Proposal
As mentioned in the **Summary** and **Motivation** sections, my proposal is somehow picking the properly labelled configmaps and then merging them somehow in the related [file](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/blob/master/cmd/argocd/commands/admin/settings_rbac.go). Roughly we can provide something like below arguments to provide mentioned functionality;
```
--multiple-policy-configmaps             boolean, defaults to false
--policy-configmap-label                    string, defaults to 'argocd-policy-file=true'
```
If this is OK, i will be glad working on the implementation of this issue!
events.comment: @crenshaw-dev sorry for asking directly here, but we would also appreciate the same idea for the ArgoCD config map itself. It could merge the config by key similar how Helm would do value merging. This would improve composability I think. Would you appreciate a similar PR for that feature?

events.title: @CollectionCacheable completely ignored
events.body:
Hey there, 

I just try to get it run with your annotation, but it seems like this annotation gets completely ignored. I have @EnableCaching and also my @Cacheable annotations work like expected, but not the CollectionCacheable.

Im using Spring 2.7.5 and Kotlin, but also tried makeing a class with java where it also did not work. I see, that the CollectionCacheableCacheInterceptor gets called in the debug mode, but never checks my annotation.

Also I have the question as I where not able to test it, if it is intended that multiple calls to en empty findAll() Method would use the cache. So that first call sees its empty, so Im putting all with their key inside and second call just gets all the entries from a cache and returns it.
events.comment:
Hi @Richie94

I've merged the [Spring Boot 2.7.5 only in 1.3.1-SNAPSHOT](https://github.com/qaware/collection-cacheable-for-spring/actions/runs/3291578732/jobs/5425911500) so far, and at least the integration tests there ran fine in the Github Action. Are the examples from the README working for you? Can you come up with a minimal reproducer for the problem you're experiencing? Either as a standalone project or (preferred) as a [failing test case](https://github.com/qaware/collection-cacheable-for-spring/blob/master/collection-cacheable-for-spring-starter/src/test/java/de/qaware/tools/collectioncacheableforspring/CollectionCacheableIntTest.java#L75) (you may add one there via pull request)?

Regarding `findAll`: The [README says that the return value, being a `Map`](https://github.com/qaware/collection-cacheable-for-spring#additional-findall-method), puts all the returned entries into the cache using the key of the map as the cache key. This essentially fills the whole cache and subsequent `findById` calls are then already cached. Another call to `findAll` will just update the cache then (cache invalidation is out of scope here, and is usually achieved by TTLs).

events.title: Resolve top-level Enums, Structs, Errors, and user-defined types from imports w/ various fixes
events.body:
This PR generalizes the logic from `SolResolver.resolveContractUsingImports(...)` to extend it to more items that can be imported:
* `contract`, `interface`, `library` (All handled by grammar as "contract")
* `enum` (top-level)
* `struct` (top-level)
* `error` (top-level)
* User-defined types (top-level)

This allows types to be highlighted and jumped to correctly.

This PR also includes the following small fixes:
* User-defined type names are now highlighted in the type definition
* Struct initialization is now highlighted as a struct name instead of a function call
* "Jump to" in struct initialization now correctly finds struct definition
* "Jump to" in revert expression now correctly finds error definition
events.comment: @SerCeMan Thanks!  I'll make sure to add more tests when I get a chance to hack on this again.

In some situation, I need lightning to truncate table before import data.
events.comment:
@lance6716 you just find the wrong document，the link you post is for db2 for zos。in db2 for luw, replace option explain as this
 ```
REPLACE Deletes all data from the table, and inserts the new data. The table definition and index definitions are not changed. If you specify this parameter when you move data between hierarchies, you can replace only the data for an entire hierarchy, not individual subtables.
```

Following is the link:
[Load with replace](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/db2/11.5?topic=commands-load)

Automatically deleting data is very dangerous so we would not considering to add it, for example, user simply re-use the old configuration file but forget to remove "truncate" configuration item. Any manually deleting better because user will be fully aware of what he/she is doing

when using db2，in many case we use load replace option， something just like that。

events.title: Feature Request: Hotkeys and open window under mouse
events.body:
Hi,

I got another idea which - I think - would be a great addition to the app:

It would be great if it was possible to assign hotkeys for each browser. For example, after clicking the link, I press "F" for Firefox, "C" for Chrome and "E" for Edge, or even simpler 1,2,3

Another usability improvement would be to have the window open where the mouse cursor is, as opposed to the center of the screen, so the path to the desired browser is shorter.

Let me know what you think.

Thanks!
events.comment: window at cursor position is a must for multi-monitor  setups

events.title: Compatibility with Java 19
events.body:
## Problem

Our project is using Java 18 and we have tried to upgrade it to Java 19.
The code compiled properly, but the modules using the ModelMapper dependency began to fail in runtime with the following message:

    Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unsupported class file major version 63 at org.modelmapper.internal.asm.ClassReader.<init>(ClassReader.java:199)

## Solution

The `org.modelmapper.internal.asm.ClassReader` class mentioned above comes from the `asm-tree` library (`org.objectweb.asm` is shaded by the `maven-shade-plugin` configured in ModelMapper).

The update of the `asm-tree` library to the latest version `9.4` seems to solve the issue: it compiles properly and there are no more runtime failures.
events.comment: Thank you very much!

events.title: refactor:(loom) change synchronized this block to ReentrantLock for PgStatement...
events.body:
Referencing https://github.com/pgjdbc/pgjdbc/issues/1951 for outline / motivation which is to improve compatibility with loom.

Change PgStatement, PgPreparedStatement and PgCallableStatement replacing synchronized (this) blocks with use of ReentrantLock to be compatible with loom.

In doing this change for PgStatement this PR must include:

All synchronized (this) blocks in PgStatement
All synchronized (this) blocks in it's sub types (PgPreparedStatement and PgCallableStatement)
I confirm that this PR includes all synchronized (this) blocks across PgStatement and all it's sub types.

Note that this PR does not add any new tests or change any existing tests. I do not believe either is required.

events.title: Added configs for resilience4j instances that only have customizers

events.title: Added configs for resilience4j instances that only have customizers
events.comment:
> But when I think about it, it could also make sense to allow it for configs

It makes sense to me, in our services we use a lot of gRPC communications and having customizer like this
```kotlin
@Bean
fun grpcRetryCustomizer(): RetryConfigCustomizer =
    RetryConfigCustomizer.of("default") {
        val retryableErrors = setOf(
            Status.Code.ABORTED,
            Status.Code.CANCELLED,
            Status.Code.UNAVAILABLE,
            Status.Code.RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED,
        )
        it.retryOnException { e -> e is StatusRuntimeException && it.status.code in retryableErrors }
    }
```
would be perfect, comparing to having to use our own manually created configuration in all places.

If that's alright with you, let me implement this approach for all resilience4j components

events.title: Nullpointer exception while trying to configure connector in Confluent Control Center
events.body:
Hi,

i got the message 
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.kaliy.kafka.connect.rss.config.UrlListValidator.ensureValid(UrlListValidator.java:18)
        at org.apache.kafka.common.config.ConfigDef.parseForValidate(ConfigDef.java:617)
        at org.apache.kafka.common.config.ConfigDef.parseForValidate(ConfigDef.java:551)
        at org.apache.kafka.common.config.ConfigDef.validateAll(ConfigDef.java:542)
        at org.apache.kafka.common.config.ConfigDef.validate(ConfigDef.java:525)
        at org.apache.kafka.connect.connector.Connector.validate(Connector.java:144)

while trying to configure the connector initial in the Confluent Control Center. I think it trys to check for the url before i even can type it in and runs into  NullpointerException (See https://github.com/kaliy/kafka-connect-rss/blob/kafka-connect-rss-0.1.0/src/main/java/org/kaliy/kafka/connect/rss/config/UrlListValidator.java) the call for 
        List<String> urlsAsList = Arrays.asList(urls.**split**(RSS_URL_SEPARATOR));

This should be handled different to make it able to configure via Control Center. 
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85624727/198309724-da18d34d-2029-4ff6-9153-000d18d07c41.png)

Setup in Docker-Compose is the usual docker-compose from confluent-community version.

events.title: Switch to  mockito-core 4.8 package, fixes JBIDE-28815
events.body:
Signed-off-by: Ondrej Dockal <odockal@redhat.com>

# Pull Request Checklist
## General
* Is this a blocking issue or new feature? If yes, QE needs to +1 this PR

## Code
* Are method-/class-/variable-names meaningful?
* Are methods concise, not too long?
* Are catch blocks catching precise Exceptions only (no catch all)?

## Testing
* Are there unit-tests?
* Are there integration tests (or at least a jira to tackle these)?
* Is the non-happy path working, too?
* Are other parts that use the same component still working fine?

## Function
* Does it work?

## Code
* Are method-/class-/variable-names meaningful?

events.title: [proposal] Deprecate traefik-opa-plugin
events.body:
Hello @blagerweij 

I am proposing to deprecate, i.e. archive https://github.com/team-carepay/traefik-opa-plugin.

That plugin was not updated for long time and is completely superseed by `traefik-jwt-plugin`.

The current plugin is much more flexible regarding OPA interaction, allowing to use headers, policy driven status code etc.

Even if users do not want to use JWT verification, they still can use current plugin, e.g. my company uses this plugin without JWT token verification, because we do it on OPA side.
events.comment: Yeah, that's a good point. I've never archived a project, let me see how we can achieve this. I believe that removing the label / tag will also ensure it's removed from the Traefik pilot website....

events.title: [proposal] OPA driven HTTP status code
events.body:
Hello

Sometimes it's required to return non 403 code but 401 instead, for example to enforce 2FA/MFA cases.
Currently it's impossible because on token / OPA error check the HTTP status code is hardcoded to 403.

Also it could be useful to make success status code OPA driven as well, i.e. extract it from configurable  field of OPA response. So, OPA can force redirect to some resource for example.

WDYT ? I am read to attempt to provide a PR for this.

events.title: Question: WildFlyDataSource IAM Authentication
events.body:
Hi @blagerweij 
We use Wildfly application server for application. Application uses JNDI Datasource for connection. How to implement IAM mysql authentication for wildfly datasource like tomcat you provided.  

I used plugin way but after 15 mins(token expiry) application is crashing.. Do i need to create custom data source?

https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly/blob/main/connector/src/main/java/org/jboss/as/connector/subsystems/datasources/WildFlyDataSource.java

Thanks
events.comment:
You did not mention which driver you're using (MySQL or MariaDB, the project provides plugins for both). Some DataSource implementations cache the password, which obviously does not work well with IAM (where the RDS token should be refreshed every 15 minutes). This project tries to refresh the token after 10 minutes.

You could also give the Amazon JDBC driver (fork from MySQL) a try, see if that works. See https://github.com/awslabs/aws-mysql-jdbc . It has support for IAM authentication, but requires a few additional JAR files on the classpath

events.title: Inconsistencies between resolved SNAPSHOT artifact and resolved SNAPSHOT parent POM
events.body:
<!--- 
Please follow the instructions below. 
We receive dozens of issues every week, so to stay productive, we will close issues that don't provide enough information. 

Please open Android-related issues on the Android Issue Tracker at https://source.android.com/source/report-bugs
Please open Gradle Native-related issues at https://github.com/gradle/gradle-native/issues
-->

<!--- Provide a brief summary of the issue in the title above -->

- Given a module `com.example:foo` with version `4.0.0-SNAPSHOT`
- Given `com.example:foo` references a parent POM called `com.example:foo-parent:4.0.0-SNAPSHOT`
- Given my build that wants to consume a timestamp version of `com.example:foo` by declaring `implementation("com.example:foo:4.0.0-20221030.075154-12")`
- When there is a later SNAPSHOT of `com.example:foo-parent` available in the repository
- Then Gradle will resolve that later version of the parent POM leading to inconsistencies
- And there is no was to control this behavior

### Expected Behavior

The parent POM should be resolved consistently with the timestamped SNAPSHOT version of the artifact or there should be a programmatic way to influence this.

### Current Behavior

As described about, the latest SNAPSHOT of the parent POM will always be selected.

### Context

I'm trying to build something against `org.apache.maven:maven-core:4.0.0-alpha-3-SNAPSHOT` so I've defined a dependency to `org.apache.maven:maven-core:4.0.0-alpha-3-20221030.075154-12`. In `org.apache.maven:maven` parent POM controls some of the version of the modules that are used in the maven build. In [this commit](https://github.com/apache/maven/commit/c6ecff9923088d854d4621e17d602f1c70dda806) the version of `org.apache.maven.resolver:maven-resolver-impl` was updated from 1.8.2 to 1.9.2. Since Gradle started to resolved the SNAPSHOT of the parent that had this change, my build started failing because I have `resolutionStrategy.failOnVersionConflict()` enabled and Gradle resolved a conflict between version 1.8.2 and 1.9.2 of `org.apache.maven.resolver:maven-resolver-impl`.

### Steps to Reproduce 
<!---
Provide a self-contained example project as an attached archive or a Github project.
You can use the following template with a Gradle GitHub action set up to showcase your problem: https://github.com/gradle/gradle-issue-reproducer
In the rare cases where this is infeasible, we will also accept a detailed set of instructions.
-->

### Your Environment
<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->
<!--- A build scan https://scans.gradle.com/get-started is ideal -->
Build scan URL:
events.comment: @ljacomet Yeah, I guess this is my expectation. I'm not sure how Maven behaves in this case but I believe it won't work there either. So maybe it's just my very specific use case. As a work around we've deployed a named version of the module, it's parent pom and all referenced modules that had the same SNAPSHOT version to our internal repository.

events.title: Add `ImportOption` `DoNotIncludeGradleTestFixtures`
events.body:
Gradle provides the `java-test-fixtures` plugin out of the box, which will add a separate source set for creating test fixtures (i.e. test support code). This source set can see the main sources and be seen by the test sources. Depending on how the tests are run they might be put onto the classpath as folder path (containing the compiled sources) or JAR archive. Thus, we have to exclude both, the folder where Gradle compiles the files to by convention and archives that follow the Gradle convention to end in `-test-fixtures.jar`. However, this can of course only be a heuristic. Custom modules that mimic the convention will e.g. also be excluded. But in these cases users have to customize their import options then, instead of using the predefined one.

Resolves: #949
events.comment: @codecholeric I can confirm that this code works in my project by copying the `DoNotIncludeGradleTestFixtures` to my code base. Thanks for looking into this!

events.title: Don't use set to define default property values
events.body:
Changes all occurences where a property default value is defined using
the set method to use convention instead, which is the idiomatic way of
setting a default value.
Furthermore all calls to `empty` on List-, Set-, and MapProperties are
dropped without replacement. These containers default to an empty
collection anyway but calling `empty` will _set_ their value to an empty
collection.

Resolves #1119
events.comment: @bmuschko done!

events.title: Tasks should not set values of properties
events.body:
<!--- Please follow the instructions below. We receive dozens of issues every week, -->
<!--- so to stay productive, we will close issues that don't provide enough information. -->

<!--- Provide a brief summary of the issue in the title above -->

When tasks are instantiated they should not `set` values of properties because setting values breaks behavior with conventions.

### Expected Behavior

It should be able to configure a conventions when using tasks from this plugin.

### Current Behavior

It's not possible to set a convention e.g. for `DockerCreateContainer.entrypoint` because `empty()` is called in the constructor which sets the value overriding any convention.

### Context

I'm writing a custom plugin on top of this plugin that configures several tasks provided by this plugin. My custom plugin should set some conventions for task values that can be overridden by build script authors. However setting conventions it in some cases not possible due to calls to `empty` and `set` in some of the tasks constructors.

### Reproducer

See https://github.com/britter/gradle-sandbox/tree/main/docker-plugin-conventions-issue
events.comment: @bmuschko Yes I think I can have a look at this.

events.title: Build: create a consumer (flatten) pom and remove all build specific items
events.body:
The project should ideally publish a consumer pom free of all build specific items. This can be accomplished by the `flatten-maven-plugin` and choosing the `ossrh` flatten style.

There is one issue tho: the flatten pom should be post processed by the shade plugin to remove the shaded dependencies. However, it happens that the shade plugin builds its dependency-reduced pom from the in-memory model and is therefore no aware of the flattening already performed by the flatten plugin. An alternate strategy is to:
- use XLST to remove shaded dependencies from the flatten pom 
- tell the shade plugin to _not_ build a dependency reduced pom and not touch the pom file already included in the jar when shading it

events.title: Implement MockHttpClient to cache HTTP responses for unit testing
events.body:
## Features

- Add MockHttpClient for caching API responses to run unit tests without an API key.

## Details

When testing a new API method, you can add the WANIKANI_API_KEY environment variable when running the unit test, which will call the API and cache the response in `src/test/resources/json`. The name of the file is an MD5 sum of the full context path of the request.

This is useful since we don't want to execute automated requests against the Wanikani API to test the library (especially when a non-trivial amount of tests are written).
events.comment: FYI @michaelboyles. This is typically how I test API client libraries (I got the idea from [Ruby's VCR library](https://github.com/vcr/vcr) a long time ago). If you want to add any unit tests in the future it could be helpful. If you have any suggestions let me know.

events.title: Add toStrings, maybe equals and hashCode, etc.
events.body:
It would be convenient if model classes had `toString` methods. Maybe `equals` and `hashCode` too.

[Lombok](https://projectlombok.org/) would make that really easy, and would let us remove some of the getter/setter boilerplate too. How do you feel about it?
events.comment: Closed in PR #15.

events.title: EnableInventory should trigger the inventory generation
events.body:
Currently when specifying `.spec.enableInventory: true` after the first time the resource applying, inventory was not appeared.
It required "force" apply to show the inventory.

We need to make sure that there will be the inventory information when this flag is true.

events.title: Is FSA prod ready ?
events.body:
Hi Team,

Great work !
Wanted to check if FSA is production ready ? we are very much interested in using FSA + Weave TF controller but  I see the git releases have "pre-release" tag.

Best regards.
events.comment:
We still consider FSA a tech-preview project for the time being. It would be able to use for visualizing your workloads.

Good news is that both Flux and Argo CD graduated this month. It would be of course a great idea to push this project for production use soon.

events.title: FSA : GitRepository object fails to clone private github repo.
events.body:
Hi,

We are facing issues when using FSA with ArgoCD. Upon creating ArgoCD application thru UI with a private github repo, the GitRepository instance shows error that its not able to clone the repo.
How to pass the github credentials in case of FSA when we select to "User Flux subsystem" and "auto-create Flux resources"?
events.comment:
No we don't have a way to provide Git credentials thru the UI yet.
You still have to use Flux commands to create credentials for Flux workloads at the moment.

But yes, we know that this feature is important for Flamingo's UX. Will address it very soon.

events.title: GitOps Run - log retrieval on server-side for UI
events.body:
As a UI developer,
I want to be able to call an API to obtain logs for a specific session,
so that these logs can be displayed on the GitOps Run UI.

Acceptance criteria:

- a Backend endpoint for the UI to call.
- It accepts a session name, the string to filter file query by suffix.
- It accepts an offset, ideally a value used for log pagination.
- it returns a set of strings, contents of each file, sorted by date.
events.comment:
I was trying to solve the problem wrongly by thinking that it would have required the information of the namespace.

But actually,
- the S3 server is in "gitops-run" bucket.
- the dashboard is in its namepace.
- the dashboard requires a privilege to access the "gitops-run" ns.
- the dashboard takes a look at the deployment object of the s3 buckt
- then traverse to obtain the credentials from a secret there.

or the dashboard would look into the flux-system namespace.
and take a look at the details of BucketSource,
then obtains the URL and secret from the source and use them to connect to the S3 bucket.

events.title: Adding required information to the session resource
events.body:
As a developer,
I'd like to obtain additional information for example the "namespace" from the session resource.

events.title: busybox test pod image repository parametric on helm chart
events.body:
<!--
 Thank you for taking the time to share an idea or requirement, we greatly appreciate your help in improving Weave GitOps! ❤️
-->

**Problem**
<!--
Does your feature request relate to a problem you experienced? What were you trying to accomplish and why?
I tried to deploy the weave-gitops controller via helm chart and wanted to deploy from own own image registry/repository. That was not issue with the controller image, but I got problems with the busybox test pod image as the related registry/repository is not configurable via the helm values.
-->

**Solution**
<!--
pls add configuration values to the helm chart so that I can also change the image repository for the busybox test pod image. Best practice would normally be to introduce also a global parameter in the helm values.yaml which sets the registry for all used images. It would be already ok if the busy box image repository can also be configured via values.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Option would be to set global and image specific parameters, but let's start just with image specific ones, then we just need to add the one for the busybox test image.
-->
events.comment:
Thank you @gsfd2000 
We'll take a look at it shortly.

events.title: Add a middleware to encode/decode MessagePack payloads
events.body: Heavily based on the Json Middleware. Uses https://github.com/lexmag/msgpax as the engine.
events.comment: Any news on this please? Will close otherwise..

events.title: Native SSH tunnel over AWS SSM
events.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, I'm connecting to my RDS instances through jump hosts over AWS SSM. Since there's no AWS SSM support yet on dbeaver, I'm creating the SSH tunnel separately on terminal, and then on my dbeaver connection settings, I connect to the databases on localhost. This is far less than ideal and not scalable when working with multiple databases and drivers.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like a native support for SSH tunnel over AWS SSM.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Perhaps having dbeaver to read from local ssh config? That way we could still make use of `ProxyCommand` to invoke aws ssm to start a session.
events.comment: This feature would indeed be great

events.title: Customized Dockerfiles throw an exception
events.body:
### Expected Behavior

I should be able to do as the docs say: 

> If you wish to customize the docker builds that are used, the easiest way is to run ./gradlew dockerfile (or dockerfileNative for the native version) and copy the generated Dockerfile from build/docker to your root directory and modify as required.

### Actual Behaviour

When I copy the `build/docker/main/Dockerfile` or the `build/docker/native-main/DockerfileNative` to the project root and run either `./gradlew dockerBuild` or `./gradlew dockerBuildNative` the build fails with the following error.

```
Error during callback
com.github.dockerjava.api.exception.InternalServerErrorException: Status 500: {"message":"Cannot locate specified Dockerfile: /Users/charlesharvey/Software/blammo/Dockerfile"}

        at com.github.dockerjava.core.DefaultInvocationBuilder.execute(DefaultInvocationBuilder.java:247)
        at com.github.dockerjava.core.DefaultInvocationBuilder.lambda$executeAndStream$1(DefaultInvocationBuilder.java:269)
```

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Checkout repo
2. `./gradlew build` (Dockerfiles have already been copied into root)

### Environment Information

- Operating System: MacOS
- JDK: 17
- Micronaut Gradle Plugin: 3.6.3

### Example Application

https://github.com/charlie-harvey/micronaut-gradle-plugin-custom-dockerfile

### Version

3.7.3
events.comment: Amazing! Thanks so much.

events.title: Add synchronous Kotlin Data Repository Interfaces
events.body:
The `CoroutineCrudRepository` and the `CoroutinePageableCrudRepository` interfaces are great if you want to run Reactive/Asynchronous database calls, I feel there is a need for Synchronous database interaction. I have been using these interfaces in my own code for a while now and really like them. Figured I could create this PR and add `KotlinCrudRepository` which adds the `@Blocking` annotation and removes the `suspend` keyword from each of the functions.

These interfaces mean I can use things like `?` instead of `Optional`. And I can leave off all the `@Nullable` and `@NotNull` annotations. This makes all my sub interfaces "pure Kotlin" which is super nice to have.

I went into each of the example kotlin modules and changed all of the tests to use the new Repositories.
events.comment:
I can work that out. I have some questions before I begin:

1) What do you think of the name `KotlinCrudRepository`? Can you think of anything better? Is it good fine?

2) As for the tests to copy, which ones and in which fashion? Copy an entire `-doc` module or just add more tests/examples to the existing module?

Thanks!

events.title: Add urlbar_persisted to query for daily search client table
events.body: We are currently collecting data on each of several search access points—locations in the browser from which our constituents can search for things. We need to add data for a search access point called "url persisted," which is the search access point where a constituent has _already put something in the search bar_ but now wants to modify that query and search again. The change request is documented in [this JIRA ticket](https://mozilla-hub.atlassian.net/browse/DENG-422). Next steps for these changes, as per the [common workflows](https://mozilla.github.io/bigquery-etl/cookbooks/common_workflows/#add-a-new-field-to-a-table-schema) guide, look like this: So we're expecting dry-run to fail until deploy runs! But I'm a little new to this repo and would love to know what the approval criteria are, in the event I review PRs in here in the future. Checklist for reviewer: - [ ] Commits should reference a bug or github issue, if relevant (if a bug is referenced, the pull request should include the bug number in the title). - [ ] If the PR comes from a fork, trigger integration CI tests by running the [Push to upstream workflow](https://github.com/mozilla/bigquery-etl/actions/workflows/push-to-upstream.yml) and provide the `:` of the fork as parameter. The parameter will also show up in the logs of the `manual-trigger-required-for-fork` CI task together with more detailed instructions. - [ ] If adding a new field to a query, ensure that the schema and dependent downstream schemas have been updated. - [ ] When adding a new derived dataset, ensure that data is not available already (fully or partially) and recommend extending an existing dataset in favor of creating new ones. Data can be available in the [bigquery-etl repository](https://github.com/mozilla/bigquery-etl), [looker-hub](https://github.com/mozilla/looker-hub) or in [looker-spoke-default](https://github.com/mozilla/looker-spoke-default/tree/e1315853507fc1ac6e78d252d53dc8df5f5f322b). For modifications to schemas in restricted namespaces (see [`CODEOWNERS`](/CODEOWNERS)): - [ ] Follow the [change control procedure](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TTJi4ht7NuzX6BPG_KTr6omaZg70cEpxe9xlpfnHj9k/edit#heading=h.ttegrcfy18ck)
events.comment:
OK! To fully document the process here, I have run the following locally:

```
  547  gcloud auth login
  548  gcloud config set project moz-fx-data-shared-prod
  549  ./bqetl query schema deploy sql.moz-fx-data-shared-prod.search_derived.search_clients_daily_v8
  550  ./bqetl query schema deploy sql.moz-fx-data-shared-prod.telemetry_derived.clients_daily_v6
  551  ./bqetl query schema deploy sql.moz-fx-data-shared-prod.udf.aggregate_search_counts
```

I _am_ getting the following error at the end of each of the `./bqetl query schema deploy` commands:

```
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/folders/ys/hp4kx45n5kd206k8dqdjmcx00000gn/T/tmpy_bwy48l/moz-fx-data-shared-prod/static/country_names_v1/data.csv'
```

Currently investigating.

events.title: EhcacheCachingProvider.getCacheManager inconsistent logic
events.body:
Calling `EhcacheCachingProvider.getCacheManager` with `Configuration` parameter has different logic depending if cache manager already exists:

- if cache manager doesn't exist, create it and create associated caches from provided configuration
- if cache manager already exists, return it

In case when cache manager already exists, **no new caches** are created from configuration.
This method should have same logic, regardless of cache manager existance.

Use case:
Testing hibernate second level cache creates a cache manager with hibernate specific caches.
After that, testing application cache with custom configuration **doesn't create** the required caches because the cache manager already was created. Thus, **null** caches are returned when requested, causing **NullPointerException**.

events.title: Allow access to the ConverterProvider for forcedType converters
events.body:
### Use case:

We use Jooq with Spring Boot and have a fairly intricately-configured Jackson `ObjectMapper` in our application, which we set up using the [Spring Boot ObjectMapper config options](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/current/reference/html/howto.html#howto.spring-mvc.customize-jackson-objectmapper).

Our Spring Jooq configuration sets up a `ConverterProvider` using the SPI and, since that's done from a `@Configuration` class, we are able to inject and re-use our fully-configured Spring `ObjectMapper`.

However, the `forcedTypes` that are defined at code generation time are only able to instantiate `Converter` instances that are defined/instantiated outside of the realm of our application start-up, meaning that our custom JSONB Jackson serialization is unable to leverage the shared `ObjectMapper` instance.

Right now we have a workaround where our `Converter` uses a `static` ObjectMapper that we simply try to ensure gets initialized using Spring application lifecycle events. This works but feels fragile and hacky. I wondered if there's a way to pull the `ConverterProvider` out of the `Configuration` at conversion time instead.

### Possible solution you'd like to see:

At a very high level, I think a `Configuration` just needs to be made available in the forced type's defined `Converter` - then I believe it could delegate to `configuration.converterProvider.provide(tType, uType).convert()`. I would imagine that changing the required method signatures to pass in a configuration is a non-starter.

I noticed the `Attachable` interface provides a `configuration` and I wondered if it might work to call `attach()` on the _converter_ itself. Something along these lines:

```kt
class ProvidedConverter<T, U>(tType: Class<T>, uType: Class<U>) : AbstractConverter<T, U>(), Attachable {
  private var cfg: org.jooq.Configuration? = null

  override fun attach(configuration: org.jooq.Configuration) { cfg = configuration }
  override fun detach() { cfg = null }
  override fun configuration(): org.jooq.Configuration? = cfg

  override fun from(databaseObject: T?): U? {
    if (databaseObject == null) return null
    val config = cfg ?: throw IllegalStateException("attach() wasn't called")
    return config
      .converterProvider()
      .provide(fromType(), toType())
      .convert(fromType(), toType())
  }

  // to() omitted
}
```

Of course I'm not sure how feasible it is to invoke `attach()` everywhere needed upstream from the conversions, or whether there are other ramifications to stashing a `configuration` reference like this.

### Possible workarounds:

Our `Converter` classes reference a static `ObjectMapper` which we just make sure is initialized from the Spring-configured Jackson mapper, thanks to lifecycle events. As mentioned above, this is a bit of a hack and it'd be nice to be able to avoid it.

### Versions:

- jOOQ: 3.16.6
- Java: 17
- Database (include vendor): Postgres
events.comment: Thanks! Look forward to giving this a try 🙏

events.title: Meta-Dashboard for all repositories
events.body:
### What would you like Renovate to be able to do?

Create a "meta dashboard" that contains information for all registered repositories.

The current dependency dashboard and merge requests are greate for projects that are actively worked on and where thus people do notice these MRs. But sometimes you have a lot of little projects and some just aren't looked at for month. There the dependency update MRs are piling up.

It would be nice to have one dashboard in the Renovate project itself that gives an overview over all registered projects to quickly see if one stands out with too many open issues: 

    project X
    * fix(deps): update dependency org.flywaydb:flyway-core to v9.10.0
    * major update to SpringBoot 3

   project Y
    *  fix(deps): update 5 minor dependencies
    
   project Z
   * major update to SpringBoot 3
   * minor update to SpringBoot 2.7.9


### If you have any ideas on how this should be implemented, please tell us here.

Collect the links to the generated tasks while iterating over all the repositories. At the end create a dashboard in the renovate project itself with all those links. 

### Is this a feature you are interested in implementing yourself?

No

You coincidently released v3.6.1 with fixes to X.509 validation and ASN.1 "indefinite length encoding" at the same time as OpenSSL had an security announcement regarding buffer overflow in X.509 email address validation which sounds vaguely similar.
It would be a nice if you could add a note that explicitly say that this is unrelated and not security relevant (assuming it is).

events.title: Paramter proxy_timeout needs unit on CLI but none in config file?
events.body:
Apparently the new proxy_timeout parameter needs a unit (like "s" for seconds) when given as CLI parameter but does not accept one when provided in the config file.

## Expected Behavior

Parameter name differes ("-" vs "_") but value is same.

## Current Behavior

When using "s" in config file:

    local-oauth2-proxy-1  | [2022/10/05 06:29:01] [main.go:45] ERROR: failed to load config: unable to load config file: While parsing config: (22, 23): unexpected token

When *not* using "s" in CLI parameter:

    local-oauth2-proxy-1  | invalid argument "200" for "--upstream-timeout" flag: time: missing unit in duration "200"

## Version used:

7.3.0
events.comment:
If it's TOML, then maybe call the example files "config.toml" in https://oauth2-proxy.github.io/oauth2-proxy/docs/configuration/overview and "config.yml" in https://oauth2-proxy.github.io/oauth2-proxy/docs/configuration/alpha-config?
That way the user would be reminded which syntactic rules apply.

## Current Behavior

events.comment:
Thanks that does explain it.

Given that the config file looks very similar to YAML, one is inclined to use the same quoting rules and YAML would parse the value as String if it doesn't look like an Int. Is your parser some Go standard library or could it be made more tolerant?

events.title: Add support for structured logging (at least JSON)
events.body:
oauth2-proxy should support structured logging. Either in a generic, flexible way or at least by adding support for JSON, which is the most popular structured logging format across a range of ecosystems.

## Expected Behavior

Ideally, it would be possible to tell oauth2-proxy to log in either "json" or "text" format with a simple option.

## Current Behavior

Currently, oauth2-proxy allows clients to pass formatters for Auth, Standard, and Request logging, but these formats are all limited to plain text because messages are not escaped before being passed to the logging template.

Since the strings aren't escaped, they can contain tokens which break the structured log parsing. For example:
```{ "message": "These nested "quotes" are unescaped JSON tokens." }```

## Possible Solution

An example of how Istio (built on envoy) exposes this to clients is with a few flags. For example, here's how I tell Istio's access log to use JSON with my own custom format:

```
  accessLogFile: /dev/stdout
  accessLogEncoding: JSON
  accessLogFormat: |
    {
      "traceId": "%REQ(x-b3-traceid)%",
      "protocol": "%PROTOCOL%",
      "upstream_service_time": "%RESP(x-envoy-upstream-service-time)%",
      "upstream_local_address": "%UPSTREAM_LOCAL_ADDRESS%",
      "duration": "%DURATION%",
      "upstream_transport_failure_reason": "%UPSTREAM_TRANSPORT_FAILURE_REASON%",
      "route_name": "%ROUTE_NAME%",
      "downstream_local_address": "%DOWNSTREAM_LOCAL_ADDRESS%",
      "user_agent": "%REQ(USER-AGENT)%",
      "response_code": "%RESPONSE_CODE%",
      "response_flags": "%RESPONSE_FLAGS%",
      "start_time": "%START_TIME%",
      "method": "%REQ(:METHOD)%",
      "request_id": "%REQ(X-REQUEST-ID)%",
      "upstream_host": "%UPSTREAM_HOST%",
      "x_forwarded_for": "%REQ(X-FORWARDED-FOR)%",
      "requested_server_name": "%REQUESTED_SERVER_NAME%",
      "bytes_received": "%BYTES_RECEIVED%",
      "istio_policy_status": "-",
      "bytes_sent": "%BYTES_SENT%",
      "upstream_cluster": "%UPSTREAM_CLUSTER%",
      "downstream_remote_address": "%DOWNSTREAM_REMOTE_ADDRESS%",
      "authority": "%REQ(:AUTHORITY)%",
      "path": "%REQ(X-ENVOY-ORIGINAL-PATH?:PATH)%"
    }
```

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)

<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant -->

1.  Configure oauth2-proxy with --standard-logging-format="{\"message\":\"{{.Message}} ({{.File}})\"}"
  1a. I am actually using the Helm chart, so my config looks like:
  ```
  standard-logging-format: >-
    {
    "message":"{{.Message}} ({{.File}})"
    }
  ```
2.  Start oauth2-proxy
3.  Look at the output. It includes nested double-quotes which break JSON parsing. For example, the very first line of output will be:
```{ "message":"mapping path "/dev/null" => file system "/dev/null" (oauthproxy.go:233)" }```

## Context

<!--- How has this issue affected you? What are you trying to accomplish? -->
<!--- Providing context helps us come up with a solution that is most useful in the real world -->

## Your Environment

<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

- Version used: 5.1.0 consumed through version 3.2.6 of the helm chart

@davsclaus it is for integrations that use some DSL other than YAML

```yaml
kind: Integration
apiVersion: camel.apache.org/v1
metadata:
  labels:
    app: camel-k
  name: example
  namespace: christoph-deppisch-dev
spec:
  flows:
    - from:
        parameters:
          period: '1000'
        steps:
          - set-body:
              constant: Hello from Camel K
          - to: 'log:info'
        uri: 'timer:yaml'
```

events.title: Consider making converters part of the public API
events.body:
Hi, thanks for the great work here!

Would you consider making the various converter methods (jfr2pprof, jfr2nflx, etc) part of a public API? Right now they can only be used as CLI tools with `converter.jar`, but it'd be useful to have the various `dump()` methods exposed as part of then `one.profiler` package in `async-profiler.jar`. Alternatively, even moving the converter code to `one.jfr` package within  `converter.jar` itself would make them more easily accessible.

I'm happy to open a PR if you're ok with the change but have other priorities.

events.title: discuss about the dotenv addToEnvironment phase
events.body:
if i add the configuration
```
log.path=${env.LOG_PATH}
```
it will throw the error
`
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Logback configuration error detected: 
ERROR in ch.qos.logback.core.joran.spi.Interpreter@6:68 - RuntimeException in Action for tag [springProperty] java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Could not resolve placeholder 'env.LOG_PATH' in value "${env.LOG_PATH}"
	at org.springframework.boot.logging.logback.LogbackLoggingSystem.loadConfiguration(LogbackLoggingSystem.java:169)
	at org.springframework.boot.logging.AbstractLoggingSystem.initializeWithConventions(AbstractLoggingSystem.java:80)
	at org.springframework.boot.logging.AbstractLoggingSystem.initialize(AbstractLoggingSystem.java:60)
	at org.springframework.boot.logging.logback.LogbackLoggingSystem.initialize(LogbackLoggingSystem.java:118)
	at org.springframework.boot.context.logging.LoggingApplicationListener.initializeSystem(LoggingApplicationListener.java:313)
	at org.springframework.boot.context.logging.LoggingApplicationListener.initialize(LoggingApplicationListener.java:288)
	at org.springframework.boot.context.logging.LoggingApplicationListener.onApplicationEnvironmentPreparedEvent(LoggingApplicationListener.java:246)
	at org.springframework.boot.context.logging.LoggingApplicationListener.onApplicationEvent(LoggingApplicationListener.java:223)
	at org.springframework.context.event.SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.doInvokeListener(SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.java:172)
	at org.springframework.context.event.SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.invokeListener(SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.java:165)
	at org.springframework.context.event.SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.multicastEvent(SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.java:139)
	at org.springframework.context.event.SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.multicastEvent(SimpleApplicationEventMulticaster.java:127)
	at org.springframework.boot.context.event.EventPublishingRunListener.environmentPrepared(EventPublishingRunListener.java:76)
	at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplicationRunListeners.environmentPrepared(SpringApplicationRunListeners.java:53)
	at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.prepareEnvironment(SpringApplication.java:345)
	at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.run(SpringApplication.java:308)
	at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.run(SpringApplication.java:1226)
	at org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication.run(SpringApplication.java:1215)
	at com.dragon.flow.manager.main.FlowManagerApplication.main(FlowManagerApplication.java:34)
`

we can dig the code to find the reason
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/346723/201815536-0fd39ae3-9771-41b1-9f08-afa2773befcf.png)

the log prepare is occured at **prepareEnvironment()**, while dotenv addToEnvironment is occured at **prepareContext()** which is later than log preparation, so it can't find the LOG_PATH in environment

so my suggestion is we should prepare the dotenv at **SpringApplicationRunListener** instead of **DotenvApplicationInitializer**
events.comment:
you can try this POC
https://github.com/clevertension/dotenv-with-spring-demo

i comment some notes in README

events.title: Generational ZGC Support
events.body:
Generational ZGC adds 'Minor' and 'Major' to the label causing the `(?:Garbage Collection)` group not to match:

```
[2022-11-22T04:18:09.618+0000][1583.644s][5085][info ][gc               ] GC(163) Minor Garbage Collection (High Usage) 42238M(95%)->16152M(36%) 0.641s
```

events.title: Add ZGC generational memory managers
events.body:
Add ZGC generational memory manager labels.

genshen uses the same memory managers, but different pools and will go into a hybrid collection when necessary, so other than checking pool size changes, I'm not sure we can do anything there:

https://github.com/openjdk/shenandoah/blob/998f68b26b8d2a5178a30a6c5b596194961e3821/src/hotspot/share/gc/shenandoah/shenandoahHeap.cpp#L2928-L2935
events.comment: Made it a `contains` check.

events.title: Add ZGC generational memory managers
events.body:
Add ZGC generational memory manager labels.

genshen uses the same memory managers, but different pools and will go into a hybrid collection when necessary, so other than checking pool size changes, I'm not sure we can do anything there:

https://github.com/openjdk/shenandoah/blob/998f68b26b8d2a5178a30a6c5b596194961e3821/src/hotspot/share/gc/shenandoah/shenandoahHeap.cpp#L2928-L2935
events.comment:
Oh yes indeed, found them:

- https://github.com/openjdk/zgc/blob/zgc_generational/src/hotspot/share/gc/z/zServiceability.cpp#L180-L181
- https://github.com/openjdk/shenandoah/blob/0dfb0a3eede0f8a20286ff0edf4d50349633bff5/src/hotspot/share/gc/shenandoah/shenandoahMemoryPool.cpp#L77-L104

events.title: Android app crashes due to duplicate emoji
events.body:
I tried to access the `#Java` tag earlier, and can reliably crash the Android app. Feels like there could be a server issue contributing so figured I'd report here too in addition to the app report:

![Screenshot_20221107-190014](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1479220/200257237-05566f78-d679-4e3d-b68b-a4032ce52a08.png)
events.comment: Nope, all the app! Sorry for the noise. https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon-android/pull/275

events.title: Exclude Findbugs JSR-305 annotation packages and classes
events.body:
On deeper investigation, it turns out the problems I had with `javax.annotation` when testing https://github.com/apache/tomcat-jakartaee-migration/pull/36 were all Findbugs JSR-305 annotation related. 

This adds excludes for the classes/packages provided by this library to avoid heavy handed translation of `javax.annotation` references.

The one special case where `jakarta.annotations` does provide them is Nullable/Nonnull, see the tests for an explanation.

events.comment:
Definitely better - moving only `tomcat-annotations-api` avoids touching a bunch of files that don't actually need a migration. Guava is completely untouched by using an inclusion list:
```
Migration starting for archive [guava-31.1-jre.jar] using streaming
Migration finished for archive [guava-31.1-jre.jar]
Migration completed successfully in [540] milliseconds
```

If I migrate `tomcat-annotations-api` to confirm coverage the only thing I notice is the parent directories aren't touched, but that doesn't affect classloading. I'd guess this isn't a concern, because the parent `javax` directory already isn't handled prior to this change, so it's already depending on the directory entry not being a dependency of extracting correctly.

Before: 
```

      411  08-08-2022 07:26   META-INF/MANIFEST.MF

...

After:

---------  ---------- -----   ----

...
    ```

events.title: Exclude Findbugs JSR-305 annotation packages and classes
events.body:
On deeper investigation, it turns out the problems I had with `javax.annotation` when testing https://github.com/apache/tomcat-jakartaee-migration/pull/36 were all Findbugs JSR-305 annotation related. 

This adds excludes for the classes/packages provided by this library to avoid heavy handed translation of `javax.annotation` references.

The one special case where `jakarta.annotations` does provide them is Nullable/Nonnull, see the tests for an explanation.

events.title: Exclude Findbugs JSR-305 annotation packages and classes
events.body:
On deeper investigation, it turns out the problems I had with `javax.annotation` when testing https://github.com/apache/tomcat-jakartaee-migration/pull/36 were all Findbugs JSR-305 annotation related. 

This adds excludes for the classes/packages provided by this library to avoid heavy handed translation of `javax.annotation` references.

The one special case where `jakarta.annotations` does provide them is Nullable/Nonnull, see the tests for an explanation.
